Description: Rim sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; part of lotus flower in added white outline with added red centres; top of rim glazed; exterior: dot band between dilute lines; below, painted decoration consisting of wide horizontal line and traces of light narrow oblique lines, possibly part of lion's mane.
Curator's comments: The sherd probably comes from the same vessel as British Museum 1924,1201.576.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 302, no. 1090)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1001) (phase 2)
